text: Skynet, the computer which controlled the machines, sent two terminators back through time.  Their mission: to destroy the leader of the human Resistance... John Connor.  My son. The first terminator was programmed to strike at me, in the year 1984... before John was born. It failed. The second was set to strike at John himself, when he was still a child.  As before, the Resistance was able to send a lone warrior.  A protector for John.  It was just a question of which one of them would reach him first...

The strange lightning forms a circular opening in mid-air the sudden flare of light we see a FIGURE in a SPHERE OF Then the FRAME WHITES OUT with an explosive THUNDERCLAP! Through the clearing vapor we see the figure clearly... a TERMINATOR has come through.  Physique: massive, perfect. devoid of emotion.  Terminator stands and impassively sur surroundings.

...John?  John!  Get in here right now and clean up that pigsty of yours. John's friend TIM, a thirteen-year-old Hispanic kid, watc replies by turning up the volume on the boom box. Janelle gives up with a SLAM of the house's back door.

A SIGN on a chain link fence topped with concertina wire PESCADERO STATE HOSPITAL FOR THE CRIMINALLY INSANE.  Beyo squats an imposing four-story building.  Institutional br Barred windows.  About as inviting as KGB headquarters. guards patrol the manicured grass.

Sunlight is a barred slash on the bare institutional wall is empty of all furnishings save the bed, a stainless ste toilet, and a dented metal mirror.  WE HEAR a rhythmic gr small explosions of breath in perfectly-metered time. PAN TO a bedframe leaned upright against the wall, legs f outward.  A pair of sweaty hands grip one leg.  Tendons k release as SOMEONE does pull-ups.  A man of tangled hair face that comes INTO FRAME, dips out, comes back. WIDER.  A WOMAN in a tank top and hospital pants in hangi top leg of the vertical bedframe.  Her body is straight a Knees bent so the feet clear the ground.  The arms are le muscular.  The inmate, face hidden, pulls up, dips, pulls a machine.  No change in rhythm.
FIGURES MOVE TOWARD US down a corridor of polished tile a tone walls.  DR. PETER SILBERMAN, a smug criminal psychol leads a group of young INTERNS.  Following laconically, a BURLY ATTENDANTS.

The next patient is a 29-year old female diagnosed as acute schizo-affective disorder. The usual indicators... depression, anxiety, violent acting-out, delusions of persecution. (the interns nod judiciously)
Here we are. Silberman stops at one of the SOUNDPROOF STEEL DOORS.  Th way speaker beneath a tiny window.  Silberman flips the i switch.
Silberman's scrubbed and cheerful face at cell window.  H comes over the tinny speaker.

'Morning, Sarah. REVERSE ANGLE as she turns slowly into CLOSE UP. SARAH CONNOR is not the same woman we remember from last eyes peer out through a wild tangle of hair like those of animal.  Defiant and intense, but skittering around looki escape at the same time.  Fight or flight.  Down one chee scar, from just below the eye to her upper lip. Her VOICE is a low and chilling monotone.
Good morning, Dr. Silberman.  How's the knee?
Silberman's smug composure drops a second.  Then returns.
Fine, Sarah. (he switches off, speaks to the interns)

She, uh... stabbed me in the kneecap with a screwdriver a few weeks ago. Sarah watches them talking about her through the glass, b hear them.  She feels like a lab animal.  The interns loo through the glass as Silberman talks.  With her face draw haggard and hair wild, she looks like she belongs where s

The delusional architecture is interesting. She believes a machine called a "terminator", which looks human of course, was sent back though time to kill her.  And also that the father of her child was a soldier, sent to protect her... he was from the future too... (he smiles)
The year 2029, if I remember correctly. (the interns chuckle)
Let's move on, shall we? As the interns walk on, Silberman steps close to DOUGLAS, attendant, and speaks low.

Douglas, I don't like seeing the patients disturbing their rooms like this.  See that she takes her thorazine, would you? DOUGLAS is 6'4", 250 pounds and warm-hearted at a rattles nods, catching Silberman's meaning, and gestures for the attendants to hang back as Silberman moves on in his roun

Sarah looks up as the cell door opens.  Douglas walks in idly tapping his POLICE BATON against the door in a omino The other two orderlies ease in behind him.  One of them STUN BATON (like a sawed-off cattle prod).  The other has cups of red liquid-thorazine.
Time to take you meds, Connor. Sarah faces him, weight centered.  Feral eyes darting fro other.
You take it. Douglas grins, casual --
Now you know you got to be good 'cause you up for review this afternoon...
I'm not taking it.  Now I don't want any trouble...

Ain't no trouble at all -- He whips the baton in a whistling backhand, which -- WHAP!  Takes her square in the stomach.  She doubles over to her knees, unable to breathe.  Douglas tips the bed an down with a crash, right new to her.  He takes her stun w the other attendant and walks forward. TIGHT ON SARAH, grimacing and struggling to breathe.

You... son of a... AAARRGH!! The stun wand hits her between shoulder blades as she tri It drives her to the floor, pinning her like a bug.  Litt ELECTRIC ARCS CRACKLE as the baton makes her writhe in pa Douglas grabs her by the hair and jerks her up to her kne the cup of thorazine in front of her lips.
Last call, sugar. Gasping, she chokes the zombie juice down.

John furtively hunches before a Ready-Teller machine at t a local bank while his friend Tim stands lookout.  John s stolen ATM card into the machine slot.  It is something h up, because trailing from the card is ribbon-wire which g some kind of black-box electronics unit he's got in his e knapsack.  He holds the pack between his knees and pulls little lap-top keyboard, which is also connected to the b John enters a few commands and the plasma-screen displays number for that account.  He quickly enters the number on Teller's keypad and asks it for 300 bucks.  The machine w begins dispensing twenty-dollar bills.  Tim looks back ov shoulder amazed.
Easy money!
Where'd you learn all this stuff? John collects the twenties as the machine kicks them out. professional electronic-age thief at ten years old.
From my mom.  My real mom, I mean.  Come on baby... (he grabs the last bills)
Let's go! They sprint around the corner to an --
They huddle behind the building as John counts out Tim's He folds five twenties and palms them to the other kid. opens his wallet to put in his money, Tim notices a pictu plastic sleeve.

That her? John reluctantly shows his friend the Polaroid.  It is a Sarah.  Pregnant, in a jeep near the Mexican border.  Joh know it now, but he will carry the photo with him for ove and give it to a young man named Kyle Reese, who will tra time to become his father.  Yes, that photo.
So she's pretty cool, huh?
Actually, no, she's a complete psycho.  That's why she's up at Pescedero.  She tries to blow up a computer factory, but she got shot and arrested.
No shit?

Yeah, she's a total loser.  C'mon, let's check out the 7-Eleven, whatya say? John has tried to sound casual, but we see in his eyes th hurts.  He slaps Tim on the shoulder and they jump onto h John fires up and they whine off down the alley.

Yeah, big guy.  On a bike.  Has that got something to do with it? Officer X registers the significance of that.  He realize big guy must be.  He smiles.  Reassuringly shakes his hea

Get the album, Janelle.

It surveys the area slowly bike idles, then kicks it into gear and moves on, scannin slow shark-like manner, not aware that it missed its prey seconds.

CLOSE ON SARAH.  She is shackled, hands and feet, to the Sunlight falls across her pale face.  A hand enter frame, stroking her cheek.  She wakes up to see -- KYLE REESE.  Sitting on the edge of her bed, looking exac same as we last saw him in 1984.  Scruffy blonde hair and raincoat.
Kyle..?  You're dead. He gives her a gentle smile.
I know.  This is a dream, Sarah.

Oh.  Yeah.  They... make me take this stuff... He puts a finger to her lips.  Then silently unfastens he They gaze into each other's eyes.  And in the look that h and the horror she has been through since hasn't touched at all.
Hold me. She melts into Reese's arms.  Pulls him to her.
I love you.  I always will.

Oh, God... Kyle.  I need you so much. She kisses him passionately.  They are locked together in moment.  PUSH IN TIGHT on Sarah as she buries her face in shoulder.  She shuts her eyes tight.  Stay on Sarah as Re He voice is strangely cold.
Where's John, Sarah? Sarah opens her eyes and he is no longer in her arms.  He across the room.  Pinning her with an accusing gaze.
They took him from me.
It's John who's the target now.  You have to protect him.  He's wide open.
I know!
Don't quit, Sarah.  Our son need you.
(struggling not to cry)
I know, but I'm not as strong as I'm supposed to be.  I can't do it.  I'm screwing up the mission.
Remember the message... the future is not set. There is not fate but what we make for ourselves. He turns toward the door.
Kyle, don't go!
(turning back to her)
There's not much time left in the world, Sarah. Reese goes out the door.  Sarah jumps from the bed, frant the door open.  Follow her out.

Sarah staggers from her cell.  Reese is already, impossib hundred feet away, striding down the dim corridor.  A sil in a long coat, disappearing around a corner. Leads her to a door.  The together.  Emerging into... 30B     A BEAUTIFUL SUNLIGHT MORNING.  CHILDREN are playi down slides, clambering through a jungle gym. She knows t coming.  It visits her every time she closes her eyes.  L alone, Sarah feels all hope recede for herself and for hu

... it's... like a giant strobe light, burning right through my eyes... but somehow I can still see.  Look, you know the dream's the same every night, why do I have to --
Please continue... 31A     The REAL SARAH dispassionately watches herself on expression is controlled.  Silberman watches her watching in a brightly-lit interview room.  TWO ATTENDANTS stands

The children look like burnt paper... black, not moving.  Then the blast wave hits them and they fly apart like leaves..." Video Sarah can't go on.  Real Sarah watches herself cry her expression cold.  We hear Silberman speak on the tape
Dreams about cataclysm, or the end of the world, are very common, Sarah... Video Sarah cuts him off, her mood shifting to sudden rag
It's not just a dream.  It's real, you moron! I know the date is happens!!
I'm sure it feels very real to you --
On August 29th 1997 it's going to feel pretty fucking real to you, too!  Anybody not wearing number two million sunblock in gonna have a real bad day, get it?
Relax now, Sarah --
You think you're alive and safe, but you're already dead.  Everybody, you, him... (she gestures are the attendant)
everybody... you're all fucking dead! She is raving, half out of her chair.  The orderly moves her with something.

You're the one living in a dream, Silberman, not me!  Because I know it happens.  It happens! 31C     Silberman pauses the tape... freezing Sarah's con Real Sarah turns away from the screen, he expression ston
I was afraid... and confused.  I feel much better, now.  Clearer. Silberman gives a calculated paternal smile.
Yes.  Your attitude have been very positive lately. Sarah looks up at him.  Her voice is hopeful.
It has helped me a lot to have a goal, something to look forward to.

And what it that? As she answers, WE PULL BACK, revealing that we have been through a one-way mirror from an adjacent OBSERVATION ROO shadows of the observation room we see that interns from earlier rounds, and a couple of STAFF PSYCHOLOGISTS.  The make the occasional note.
You said I could be transferred to the minimum security wing and have visitors if I showed improvement in six months.  Well, it's been six months, and I was looking forward to seeing my son.
I see.  Let's go back to what you were saying about these terminator machines.  Now you think they don't exist? CLOSE ON SARAH.  Her voice sounds hollow.
They don't exist.  I see that now. Silberman leans back, studying her.  Toying with her.
But you've told me on many occasions about how you crushed one in a hydraulic press.
If I had, there would have been some evidence. They would have found something at the factory.
I see.  So you don't believe anymore that the company covered it up? Sarah shakes her head no.
The corporate headquarters of a mega-electronic corporati imposing cubist castle of black glass.

Listen, Mr. Dyson, I know I haven't been here that long, but I was wondering if you could tell me... I mean, if you know...
Know what?
Well... where it came from.
I asked them that question once.  Know what they told me?  Don't ask.

IT -- rectangle, about the size of a domino, the color of liver been shattered, painstakingly reconstructed and mounted o frame. In this cabinet is a larger object... an intricate AND FOREARM. At the elbow, the metal is twisted and crushed.  But the hand are intact.  Its metal surface scorched and discolor stands upright in a vacuum flask, as if saluting.  This i remains of the terminator Sarah destroyed.  Dyson stares in thought.  The he closes the cabinet, BLACKING OUT FRAM
We can see through the one-way mirror into the interview Sarah is still talking with Silberman.  The OTHER PSYCHOL still watching through the mirror.  Reviewing Sarah's con

But her finger won't do it. She lowers the gun very slowly.  It drops to her side in All the breath and energy seems to go out of her. She weakly raises her other hand in a strange gesture, li where you are, don't move".  As if, should they move, the balance might tip back the other way. She backs away from them slowly, panting.  It's as if she away in terror from what she almost did.  She reaches a w slumps against it.  Slides down to her knees.  The gun fa from her fingers. She rests her cheek against the wall. 136A    The front door is kicked in. Terminator steps inside.  John grabs his sleeve and pushe He scopes out the situation in two seconds... Sarah, the sobbing family.  John moves to Sarah while Terminator che John kneels in front of his mother.  She raises her head him.  He sees the tears spilling down her cheeks,
Mom?  You okay?
I couldn't... oh, God. (she seems to she him for the first time)
You... came here... to stop me?

Uh huh. She reaches out and takes his shoulder suddenly, surprisi drawing him to her.  She hugs him and a great sob wells u her, from a spring she had thought long dry.  She hugs hi as the sobs wrack her. John clutches her shoulders.  It is all he ever wanted.
It's okay.  It'll by okay.  We'll figure it out.
I love you, John.  I always have.
I know, Mom.  I know. TARISSA looks around at the bizarre tableau.  Terminator wordlessly ripped open Dyson's shirt and examined the wou
Clean penetration.  No shattered bone. Compression should control the loss of blood. He takes Tarissa's hands and presses them firmly over the exit wounds.
Do you have bandages?

In the bathroom.  Danny, can you get them for us? Danny nods and runs down the hall. John disengages from Sarah.  She wipes her tears, the ins toughen up taking over again.  But the healing moment has effect, nevertheless. John walks toward Dyson and Terminator.
Who are you people? John draws the Biker's knife from Terminator's boot.  Han

Show him. Terminator takes off his jacket to reveal bare arms. John takes Blythe by the hands and leads her down the hal from what is about to happen. 136B    TIGHT ON TERMINATOR'S left forearm as the knife m below the elbow.  In one smooth motion, Terminator cuts a around his arm.  With a second cut, he splits the skin of from elbow to wrist. TERMINATOR grasps the skin and strips is off his forearm surgeon rips off a rubber glove.  It comes off with a suc leaving a bloody skeleton. But the skeleton is made of bright metal, and is laced wi actuators.  The fingers are as finely crafted as watch pa flex into a fist and extend.  Terminator holds it up, pal almost the exact position of the one in the vault at Cybe HOLD ON DYSON reacting to the servo-hand in front of him. He's seen one of these before. Tarissa is screaming now, but he doesn't hear her.
My God.
Now listen to me very carefully.

Sarah puts out her fifth cigarette.  She's sitting on the John, Terminator, Dyson, and Tarissa are at the kitchen t a single overhead light. Dyson looks like that guy on the Sistine Chapel wall, the soul... eyes fixed and staring with terrifying knowledge. shoulder is bandaged.  Terminator's arm is wrapped with a bandage below the elbow.  The steel forearm and hand glea harsh kitchen light.  TRACKING AROUND THE TABLE as Termin speaks... we don't hear the words.

Dyson listened while the Terminator laid it all down.  Skynet.  Judgment Day... the history of things to come.  It's not every day you find out you're responsible for 3 billion deaths. He took it pretty well, considering... Terminator finishes speaking.

I feel like I'M gonna throw up. He looks around at them, clutching the table like he's ab away.  His face, his posture, his ragged voice express so terror.  This is a man ripped out of normal life into the world.  His voice is pleading.
You're judging me on thing's I haven't even done yet.  Jesus.  How were we supposed to know? Sarah speaks from the shadows behind them.  Dyson turns t looking right at him.

Yeah.  Right.  How were you supposed to know? Fucking men... all you know how to do is thrust into the world with your... fucking ideas and your weapons.  Did you know that every gun in the world is named after a man?  Colt, Browning, Smith, Thompson, Kalashnikov... all men.  Men built the hydrogen bomb, not women... men like you thought it up.  You're so creative.  You don't know what it's like to really create something... to create a life.  To feel it growing inside you.  All you know how to create is death... you fucking bastards.
Mom, Mom, we need to be more constructive here. I don't see this as a gender-related issue. (to the Dysons)
She's still tense. (to Sarah)
We still have to figure out how to stop it all from happening.  Right?
But I thought... aren't we changing things?  I mean... right now?  Changing the way it goes?
(seizing on that)
That's right!  There's no way I'm going to finish the new processor now.  Forget it.  I'm out of it.  I'm quitting Cyberdyne tomorrow... I'll sell real estate, I don't care,,,
(coldly)
That's not good enough. Dyson's voice is pitiful.
Look, whatever you want me to do, I'll do.  I just want my kids to have a chance to grow up, okay?
No one must follow your work.
(thoughts racing)
Alright, yeah.  You're right.  We have to destroy the stuff at the lab, the files, disk drive... and everything I have here.  Everything! I don't care.

head_text.subj: FIRE ROARING IN A METAL TRASH BARREL.

text: Stacks of files are dumped onto it. WIDER reveals we are in --

Terminator dumps lighter fluid liberally over the fire, w up, lighting his face demonically.  Sarah, Dyson, Tarissa return from his office with more stuff -- files, notes, o Even his kids are carrying stuff.  It all goes into the f drops the prototype onto the fire... his eyes hollow and He stares into the fire, watching his world burning.  The sudden thought.
Do you know about the chip?
What chip?
They have it in a vault at Cyberdyne... (to Terminator)
It's gotta be from the other one like you.
(to Sarah)
The CPU from the first terminator.
Son of a bitch, I knew it!
They told us not to ask where they got it.  I thought... Japan... hell, I don't know.  I didn't want to know.
Those lying motherfuckers!
I was scary stuff, radically advanced.  It was shattered... didn't work.  But it gave us ideas, It took us in new directions... things we would never have thought of.  All this work is based on it.
I must be destroyed.
(to Dyson)
Can you get us in there, past security?
I think so, yeah.  When? Dyson looks at her, Terminator, then John.  Sees his answ
Now? (he takes a breath)
Yeah, right. He turns to his wife.  Her face is streaked with tears, b are strong and clear.  Tarissa puts her hands on his arm. stunned by what she's heard, but dealing with it.  She be
Miles, I'm scared.  Okay.  But the only thing that scares me more than you going... is you not going. He nods.  She's right.
(to Terminator)
Is it safe for them here?
(to Tarissa)
Take your kids.  Go to a hotel.  Right now. Don't pack. (to the others)
Let's go.
Pavement rushing at us, lit by headlights.  Beyond, darkn

The future, always so clear to me, has become like a black highway at night.  We were in uncharted territory now... making up history as we went along. TILT UP to reveal a rectangle of light ahead.  The Cyberd Building...

TIGHT ON A CARD-KEY SCANNER as Dyson's hand zips his secu through a slot in one motion.  There is the sound of a se and -- 139A    DYSON enter the spacious lobby, followed by Sarah Terminator last of all.  In a frontal angle, the others b Terminator from view. THE GUARD at the front desk, GIBBONS, looks up as Dyson m him.  Dyson is pale and sweaty, but smiles warmly at the speaking well before he reaches the desk.
Evening, Paul.  These are friends of mine from out of town, I just thought I'd take them up and show them around.
I'm sorry, Mr. Dyson.  You know the rules about visitors in the lab.  I need written authoriz -- K-CHAK!  Gibbons is staring down the barrels of Sarah's . Terminator's MAC-10.
I insist. The guard is too stunned to move.  We see that Terminator his jacket and one black glove. Gibbon's eyes go to the silent alarm button on the consol
Don't even think about it. Gibbons nods.  He stays frozen.  Terminator circles quick the guard out of the chair.  John pulls a roll of duct-ta knapsack and tears off a piece.

ELEVATOR DOORS OPEN and Terminator leads the group warily corridor.  They have a cart piled high with gear in nylon Dyson motions down the corridor to the right.  As they wa continues to fill them in --
The vault needs two keys to open.  Mine... (holds up key)
... and one from the security station.  It's in a locker but my card should access it.  Here we go. They stand in front of a wide security door.  A sign abov
his key-card through the scanner and the door unlatches.

A ROVING GUARD, MOSHIER, strolls down the long corridor f first-floor office block.  A punch clock swings at his hi just completed his circuit of the building.  He passes th elevators and rounds the corner to the front desk, callin
Honey, I'm home... He sees the desk is deserted and frowns.  Figures Gibbons the can, so checks that first before getting alarmed. TRACKING WITH HIM to the restroom around the corner,

Hey, man, you shouldn't leave the -- 142A    OVER HIS SHOULDER we see past the door as he push Gibbons handcuffed to the urinal.  Moshier spins on a dim to the desk where he slams down on the silent alarm butto

The security station is a pass-through area with a counte which are desks and a bank of monitors, showing boring mo empty corridors.  Dyson crosses quickly to a locker behin monitor area.  He swished his card repeatedly through the the locker.  Nothing happens.  The light on the locker is red.  Sarah notices Dyson's alarmed expression.
What?  WHAT IS IT? Dyson whips around, staring at a light flashing on the co him.
Silent alarm's been tripped.  It neutralizes the codes throughout the building.  Nothing'll open now. We see his nerve snapping.
We should abort.
NO!! We're going all the way!  You got that, Dyson? She's right in his face.  Somehow, it works for him.  He some resolve from somewhere.
Moshier's gotten Gibbons loose.  He's on the phone to the
... multiple armed subjects.  Look, I think it's the guy from that mall shootout, and the woman... yeah, her.  Pretty sure.  Just send everything you've got in the area --
John jumps up on the desk next to the wall-mounted locker stares in amazement as John starts pulling his counter-el gear out of his knapsack.  It's just another Ready-Teller
You guys get started on the lab... I can open this. 145A    Dyson leads Terminator and Sarah to the main lab servo-lock. He tries his card.  Nothing.
No good.

Let me try mine. He unslings the M-79, pulling it over his shoulder in one Sarah grabs Dyson and drags him back down the hall. Terminator opens the breach and slide in one of the fat 4 grenades.  He flips the thing closed with a snap of the w
(yelling as she runs)

John!  Fire-in-the-hole! John drops what he is doing, and covers his ears. Terminator fires at inhumanely close range. 145B    The door EXPLODES into kindling.  The concussion open, and flying shrapnel whizzes all around him.  Before thunderclap has faded Terminator walks into the fire and John goes back to work without missing a beat. Sarah and a stunned Dyson walk through the burning doorfr Artificial Intelligence Lab. A SIREN is sounding.  The HALON FIRE-CONTROL SYSTEM has b triggered.  The invisible gas roars in, putting out the f
Fire's set off the halo system!  Here... hurry! Dyson runs to a wall cabinet and pulls out some BREATHING hands one to Sarah and dons the other.  Then he reaches o one to Terminator.
Here! Terminator doesn't need a mask, since is oxygen requireme low.  He ignores Dyson as he removes his massive backpack it.  Dyson shrugs and tosses the mask on a desk.  He turn
(yelling through the mask)

We'll have to keep these on a couple minutes, till the gas clears. Terminator pulls two five-gallon jerry-cans of gasoline f pack. Sarah starts pulling out book-sized, olive-grab CLAYMORE stacking them next to the gasoline.  Dyson stares.  Part believe they're really doing this.
The T-1000 moves slowly though the ravaged office, analyz happened here.  It walks down the dark hallway.  The plac deserted.  The police-walkie clipped on its belt (real, n blares to life.
All units, all units.  211 in progress at 2144 Kramer Street, the Cyberdyne building.  Multiple suspects, armed with automatic weapons and explosives.  SWAT unit is en route...
The T-1000 sprints up and throws its leg over the big C.H Fires it up.  It smokes an arcing scorch-mark on the pave spins around and roars away.

TIGHT ON A LARGE DISK DRIVE.  State-of-the-art.  Very exp FIRE AXE smashes down through the housing, shattering the 148A    WIDER, revealing a scene of high-tech pillage.  T disk drive into junk and steps to another.  WHAM.  Same r already demolished half a dozen. Sarah topples a file cabinet, scattering files. Dyson staggers up with an armload of heavy M-O (magnetic- disks and drops them on a growing stack in the middle of He and Sarah have their breathing masks hanging down arou necks, since the halon gas has dissipated.
(to Sarah, panting)
Yeah, all that stuff!  And all the disks in those offices.  Especially my office... everything in my office! (to Terminator)
These, too!  This is important. (SMASH!)

And all this here... that's it. 148B    Sarah goes into Dyson's office and starts hurling door onto the central junkpile... books, files, everythin desk. A FRAMED PHOTO of Dyson's wife and kids lands on top of t Tarissa, hugging Danny and Blythe, all grinning.  The gla shattered. 148C    Terminator cuts a swath, under Dyson's direction, into fragments with his inhuman swings. SMASH!  It's carnage.  Millions in hardware, and all irre fruits of their years of research... shattered, broken, d heap for the big bonfire of destiny. Dyson stops a second, panting.
Give me that thing a second. Terminator hands him the axe.  Dyson hefts it one-handed. a lab table... on it is another prototype processor.
I've worked for years on this thing. Swinging awkwardly but with great force he smashes the ax the processor prototype, exploding it into fragments.  Hi agony, but he looks satisfied.
John taps away at his little lap-top, which is running co combinations into the card-key lock.  Suddenly, the green the lock goes on and it unlocks with a clunk.
Easy money. He whips it open, revealing a rack of keys.  But the VAUL distinctive, a long steel rectangle on a neck-chain.  Joh and runs toward the lab.

Sarah and Terminator are working like a crack team, riggi explosives.  She is taping the claymores to the gas cans tape to create powerful incendiary bombs.  Terminator is claymores and blocks of C-4 plastic explosive to the larg COMPUTER cabinets nearby.  All the claymores are wired ba detonator with has a RADIO-CONTROL RELAY switch.
How do you set them off? Terminator shows him a REMOTE DETONATOR, a small transmit red plunger.
Radio remote. He makes a plunger-pushing motion with his thumb and an a "click" sound.  Dyson nods. Just then John comes running in, holding up the key.
I got it.  Piece of cake.
(to Dyson and Terminator)
Go!  I'll finish here. They run out as the SOUND OF SIRENS grow louder outside.
I'll deal with the police.
Remember what I said, you can't...
Trust me.
The security duo of Moshier and Gibbons cowers behind car parking lot in front of the building.  They turns as L.A. AND-WHITES pour into the lot, turn the area into a disco blue and red lights.

The cops are jumping from their cars and ducking behind t Emphasis on small arms here.  Behind them an ugly BLACK S screeches into the lot. 153A    We hear the THUMP OF ROTORS as a POLICE CHOPPER a close to the building.  It rakes its XENON SPOTLIGHT thro second floor offices.

Terminator crosses the office toward the floor-to-ceiling He is outlines starkly by the spotlight as it rakes throu offices.  Without breaking stride he kicks an executive d the window. 154A    Glass explodes outward and the desk topples, fall below. 154B    Terminator, standing at the edge, FIRES A LONG BU police cars lines up below.  Cops duck as glass flies.  T with his superb aim, hits no one.  But noticed is served. 154C    The cops (surprise) FIRE BACK.  Terminator turns calmly from the window as glass, office furniture, drapes riddled by return fire.  A few rounds hit his back, but h notice.  He reloads as he walks.
TIGHT ON A KEY inserted into one of the vault locks. WIDER as John and Dyson stand poised, hands on keys.

And let's see what's behind door number one. Dyson nods and they turns the keys together.  The vault g itself, withdrawing it locking bolts with a final KLONK! Together Dyson and John swing the door open.

The varsity takes the field as the SWAT TROOPERS sprint f squads.  They flank the lobby and work their way inside, rapidly.  They move and freeze, behind cover, quivering w adrenaline.  They have all that great SWAT equipment:  bo gas-masks, M-16s, tear-gas launchers, ropes.  The works. a lot of hand signals and keep their mouths shut.  They'r trained and deadly. 157     OUTSIDE we see cops firing TEAR GAS grenades thro windows into second-floor offices.

John and Dyson are isolated from the world in this silent Dyson opens the cabinet containing the terminator relics. turn to stare with uneasy deja-vu as he sees the terminat CPU. Then in one vicious move he sweeps his arm behind the ine and hurls them to the floor.  They SHATTER.  John snatche and the metal hand out of the broken glass.
Got ol' Skynet by the ball now, Miles.  Come on, let's book! Clutching the steel hand and pocketing the chip like it's he just bought, John runs out.  Dyson follows.
We see the advance squad of SWATs make it to one of the s They start up, two at a time, covering each other rituali the numbers.
John pelts into the lab with Dyson stumbling along behind Sarah is just finished wiring all the charges to the cent detonator.
Ready to rock?

Ready. John tosses her the metal hand.  She catches it and bends hand in her empty back-pack.  Sarah zips the pack and sta into it. Dyson's running out of steam.  The bandages at his should with seeping blood.  He stands in the middle of the lab, goodbye in his mind, looking weak and empty. Terminator strides into the lab.
Time to go.  Right now. He and John head back the way they came, through security Sarah sees that in her work, she has set the detonator do feet away, near where Dyson is standing.
Dyson, hand me the detonator.  Let's go -- He gingerly picks up the detonator.  Starts toward her.

SWAT LEADER  and two others OPEN FIRE. Their M-16s rake the room.  Sarah dives behind a computer Dyson is HIT.  He is slammed to the floor by the impacts. 161     IN THE HALL, John hears the firing and spins to r

Mommm!!! Terminator grabs him as bullets slam into his broad back. it around the corner with John, out of the line of fire. 162     IN THE LAB, bullets rake over Sarah's head, smack clanging into the machine protecting her.  She can see Dy on the floor.  Debris and flying glass rain on her as the on the fire.  The detonator is clutched in his hand.  He her, his eyes bulging from the pain of his torn-up guts.

Go. 162A    Sarah hesitates a split second.  Then she snap-ro through broken glass and debris into the hall where -- TERMINATOR grabs her by the jacket and hauls her roughly Bullets rake the walls behind them as they sprint forward round the corner.  John does a fast take that she's not h run together through the security checkpoint.
John reaches the first door, and tries it.  Locked. Terminator unslings the M-79 blooper smoothly, opening th
Get back. He pulls a grenade from the bandolier over his shoulder, it into the bore.  Flick his wrist.  The breech snaps shu and John have a split second to duck and cover.

Cover you ears and open you mouth. 163A    They do.  KABOOM!!! Twenty feet away the door, an around it, EXPLODES outward.  The backblast hits Terminat force, but he strides through the smoking hole before the even hit the floor.

SWAT LEADER moves cautiously through the lab.  Cat-steppi circles around a desk which block Dyson's body from his v M-16 is leveled crisply.  We look over his shoulder as he desk, revealing -- MILES DYSON is not dead.  He will be very soon, but at th is conscious.  He has propped himself up against the desk BOOK in one hand.  A heavy technical manual. Below the book is the detonator, upright on the tile floo The message is clear.  "Shoot me, the book drops on the p Adios."  Dyson wheezes, trying to draw enough breath to t

I don't know... how much longer... I can... hold this thing... SWAT Leader seems to see the wires, the claymores, the ga around him for the first time.  His eyes, visible through mask, go very wide. He spins and motions his squad back.
Fall back!!  Everybody out!  Move it!  OUT
They retreat so fast they crash into the next group comin stairs.
Terminator reaches the main elevators.  Hits the button. John are coughing and stumbling in the choking darkness, breathing with the single mask.  The doors open.  They ge elevator and head down.

Dyson is lying amid the ruins of his dreams.  Sprawled on he has his back propped up against the desk.  He is bathe blood, which runs out in long fingers across the tiles. is shallow and raspy.  He still holds the book, trembling switch. In his lap is the picture from his desk.  He has pulled i debris next to him.  A tear trickles from his eye.  His w children smile up at him through broken glass.
169     CUT TO THE PUPIL OF HIS EYE, at the moment of dea light fade from his eyes and he is gone -- His arm drops and the book his the switch --

As the face of the building EXPLODES in an eruption of gl Remains of the second-floor windows shower the parking lo fireball rolls out, leaping into the sky. The cops look up, stunned.  The helicopter banks away fro Burning debris falls among the cop cars and a number of o break ranks, pulling back. 171     ONLY ONE OF THEM seems to be moving with purpose. just arrived drives through the disorganized crowd, direc the building. 171A    T-1000 guns the bike up a ramp to a pedestrian br from a parking structure to the Cyberdyne building.  It e second floor, which is now a burning maze.

T-1000 drives into the smoky wreckage.  It draws a Hoechl MPK machine pistol and cruises slowly into the firelit of scanning. 172A    IN THE CORRIDOR the bike skirts flaming wreckage T-1000 scans the leaping shadows for its prey.

The elevator doors part and Terminator eases a look out i corridor.  The walls on either side of him ERUPT WITH BUL The SWATs have the lobby end of the corridor blocked off. totally trapped, cut off and screwed.
(to Sarah)

Don't forget.  It's always darkness right before... you're totally fucked. 173A    The SWATs fire a tear-gas grenade toward the elev vicious CS gas out in a swirling cloud which envelops Sar who are pressed against the back wall of the elevator.
Keep your eyes closed.  Don't move. (they nod, eyes squeezed shut)

I'll be back. He slings the grenade launcher over his shoulder and walk the corridor. 173B    BLAM.  A tear-gas grenade ricochets from wall to the corridor.  It skids to rest in front of Terminator, t a white cloud which quickly fills the corridor. 173C    In the elevator, Sarah and John are choking, hand mask back and forth desperately.  They're scarred.  This it. 173D    ANGLE ON THE SWAT TEAM, gripping their weapons at corridor.  They watch the boiling cloud, waiting. 173E    THEIR POV -- on the wall of boiling smoke.  A FIG Totally unaffected.  Terminator emerges from the smoke. misty-eyed.  Not what they expected.
(through megaphone)

Stop where you are.  Lie down on the floor, face down.  Down on floor, now! He continues to stride toward them. The SWATs tense up.  They've never seen anything like thi not sure what to do.  Closer and closer.

Drop him. They OPEN FIRE.  The corridor is filled with CRACKING THU rounds tear into Terminator's chest.  Stomach.  Face.  Th leather jacket leaps and jerks as the rounds hit him.  Th think the guy's wearing body armor or something.  They ke The rounds tear into him, staggering him slightly, but he moving.
You're not hitting him!
(getting scared)

Yes I am! Terminator draws his .45 smoothly.  Unhurried.  He shoots man in the left thigh.  As he screams and drops, Terminat him in the right thigh.  Terminator bends down and picks shrieking man's weapon... the TEAR-GAS LAUNCHER. It is one of those new rotary jobs that hold 12 rounds in Terminator shoots the next SWAT in the chest with the tea launcher.  The gas canister hits the guy's body armor and penetrate.  But it's like getting slugged in the stomach swing from a baseball bat.  The SWAT fold double and hits gasping. Terminator is an image from Hell, a tall figure in shredd leather, streaked with blood.  One eye is a bloody socket eye-servo glistening.  The flesh of one cheek hangs down revealing the chrome cheekbone beneath.  The whole front jacket is blown open, revealing his metal armor chest. The remaining SWATs start to fall back.  One turns to run KPOW!  A gas canister nail him in the back, sending him s 173F    Terminator fires three gas canisters into the lob rapidly with the white gas, cutting the visibility to a f is total pandemonium.  SWAT LEADER crouches in the fog, w knuckling the rifle.  Terminator looms suddenly out of th in front of him.  POOM!  Terminator drills him in the leg .45.  As the guy screams and drops rifle to clutch his le rips his gas mask off.  The SWAT leader drops writhing to choking and gagging, clutching his bleeding thigh. Terminator walks up to two SWATs at the front doors.  POW and leg.  He snatches their masks as they fall.  The gunf stopped.  Nobody an see anything.  Screams and whimpers e smoke.

Smoke boils out of the front door as a figure emerges.  F tear-gas launcher with one hand, Terminator launches all rounds among the cop vehicles.  Unprotected officers run, and half-blind, slamming into cars and tripping over each is a total rout. 175     AT THE SWAT VAN on of the SWATs is rapidly handin masks to unprotected cops.  A FIGURE appears out of the s him.  He looks up.  His mask is ripped off and he is hand launcher.  Instinctively he catches it.  Terminator grabs vest with one hand and sails him out into the mist.
Terminator strides the length of the van and climbs into seat.  No keys in the ignition.  He flips down the sun vi keys fall into his hand.  He starts the van and slams it

The tear gas has cleared to a thin haze.  The uninjured S tending their wounded.  They look up at the sound of shou roaring engine. 176A    THE SWAT VAN CRASHES INTO THE LOBBY in an explosi debris.  Cops scatter as the van screeches across the lob smoking one-eighty, sliding to a stop across the corridor to the bank of elevators.  Terminator backs up until -- c seals the corridor with the back of the van. 176B    Sarah and John stumble along the corridor, coughi They leap into the back of the van and Terminator hits th The van roars across the lobby and exits through blown-ou

T-1000, astride the Kawasaki, looks down from a second-fl and sees the van tearing across the parking lot with the cops firing at it.  It knows.  It looks around.  Analyzin It sees the helicopter hovering outside the building at t this corner office block... It twists full throttle on the powerful bike. Roars through the office, accelerating fast, straight at windows -- 178     T-1000 BLASTS OUT THROUGH THE GLASS, airborne on rockets across the gap to the hovering chopper and -- 178A    SLAMS into the canopy.  The impact of bike and ri chopper radically.  The startled PILOT fights to regain c bike tumbles to the pavement below. 178B    The T-1000 doesn't.  It clings to the shattered c Nightmarishly, the pilot watches as the T-1000 smashes it through the plexiglass canopy and rapidly POURS ITSELF th jagged hole.  It reforms instantly into its previous self passenger seat. 178C    It hurls the pilot out of the chopper and slides seat. The chopper is auto-rotating, spinning out of control.  I toward the parking lot.  T-1000 recovers control ten feet ground. 178D    Cops hits the deck as the tail-boom swings around inches. The chopper lifts out in a power climb, roaring away acro parking lot toward the fleeing SWAT van. OKAY, BUCKLE YOUR SEATBELTS, HERE IT COMES...

Terminator looks back at his two passengers as he turns t onto a divided highway.  Sarah and John are catching thei still coughing from the CS gas.  Terminator look to the r mirror.  He sees the xenon searchlight of the chopper beh gaining. Sarah looks around the inside of the SWAT van.  It is a r armory.  There are rifles, ballistic vests, all manner of

John, get under these.  Hurry! He sits against the front bulkhead of the van and she pil proof vests on top of him, completely covering him.  Then two M-16s from the wall-rack and loads them.  She starts as -- 180     The SWAT van weaves through sparse traffic at hig Terminator slews the unstable van around cars and trucks be crawling.  The van hits it top speed of eighty.  They miss the back end of A WHITE 18-WHEEL TANKER. 180A    The chopper swings in behind them, closing fast. 180B    T-1000 reaches through the shattered canopy with pistol and FIRES.  The back of the can CLANGS WITH HITS. windows are BLOWN IN. head_text.subj: THE SUN, PURE IN A CLOUDLESS SKY

text: Tilting down reveal that we are in a park, very green.  P casually dressed, having fun.  Cycling, reading... childr playing in a playground. Beyond the line of tree we see the skyline of Washington, the Capital Building and the Washington Monument.  The sk subtly changed, with a lot of new buildings, advanced hig

WE BOOM DOWN AND TRACK LATERALLY through a playground in foreground.  Children swinging on swings.  Sliding down s Timeless things that 4 decades of technical advancement w change.  As we track we hear:

August 29th 1997 came and went.  Nothing much happened.  Michael Jackson turned forty.  There was no Judgment Day.  People went to work as they always do, laughed, complained, watched TV, made love. We pass a jungle gym, neither melted nor burned, but full swinging and yelling raucously.  Past it we drop down to pumping the pedals of a tricycle.

I wanted to run down the street yelling... to grab them all and say "Every day form this day is a gift.  Use it well!"  Instead I got drunk. STILL TRACKING we come to rest on an elderly woman seated It is SARAH, now 64 years old.  The world has aged her, b at peace in this moment.  She speaks into a microcassette

That was thirty years ago.  But the dark future which never came still exists for me, and it always will, like the traces of a dream lingering in the morning light.  And the war against the machines goes on.  Or, to be more precise, the war against those who build the wrong machines. There is a man in is forties playing with two small child nearby.  He turns.  It is John Connor.  Through he has th features in adulthood, there is no eye-patch, no scarring from the haggard man on grim destiny we saw in the world have been.  But there is still penetrating intelligence, in his eyes.
John fights the war differently than it was foretold.  Here, on the battlefield of the Senate, the weapons are common sense... and hope. A FOUR-YEAR-OLD GIRL runs to her to have her shoelace tie
Tie me, grandma. Grandma Sarah smiles.  It is the only time we have seen h far.  She bends as the little girls puts her foot up on t She ties as we hear:
The luxury of hope was given to me by the Terminator.  Because if a machine can learn the value of human life... maybe we can too. Sarah ruffles the kids's hair as she runs off to play wit
